name: LighthouseOfAlexandria
description: Lighthouse built by the Ptolemaic Kingdom between 280 and 247 BC which has been estimated to be 100 metres in overall height.

name: MausoleumAtHalicarnassus
description: Tomb built between 353 and 350 BC at Halicarnassus (present Bodrum, Turkey) for Mausolus, a satrap in the Persian Empire, and his sister-wife Artemisia II of Caria.

name: StatueOfZeusAtOlympia
description: A sculpture of ivory plates and gold panels over a wooden framework, it represented the god Zeus sitting on an elaborate cedar wood throne ornamented with ebony, ivory, gold and precious stones.

name: GreatPyramidOfGiza
description: Oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex bordering what is now El Giza, Egypt.

name: HangingGardensOfBabylon
description: Remarkable feat of engineering with an ascending series of tiered gardens containing a wide variety of trees, shrubs, and vines.

name: TempleOfArtemisAtEphesus
description: Greek temple dedicated to an ancient, local form of the goddess Artemis.
